page.title: 11Travel in Cheshunt
page.content: Public transport in Cheshunt is quite good.Train services to London run approx. every 15 minutes in the rush hour.Double decker buses run frequently along the main shopping centre.This is separated from the rural area by the busy A10 between London and the north.Since 1982 Tesco's free bus service collects customers from various towns and villages. A rush hour census on the A10 counted 415 vehicles in 15 minutes!The traffic thundered past in waves.Cars and pedestrians find it very difficult to cross the A10 at these times.A survey in our junior school showed that the majority of parents travel to work by car.People walk or cycle along the quiet country lanes yet within minutes you can join one of the country's main arterial roads.
